Content: What if a meteor fell from the sky_ right onto your house?
Could you do anything at all to prevent it?
I don't think such a destructive thing that happens by purely random cahnce should be added.

*This is a game.*NLWe can decide what does and doesn't go inside it_ unlike real life. I'd stop playing in newer versions if they added such things because it wouldn't be fun to suddenly lose everything due to random chance.
Everything that's destructive in the game is the player's fault_ except lightning. You need to have done something to cause it_ such as letting a creeper explode.
There's lots of ideas to add. A cool volcanic landscape with __inactive__ volcanoes would be an amazing place to visit.
There are already sea biomes...
🤦 cold/lukewarm/warm oceans?
Well_ like it or not_ but those are an example of ocean biomes
A new igneous rock material for building would be awesome.
😄 These are only a few ideas I just came up with on the spot. Anything I'd like to see in the game you can't even see unless you looked for it.

Will this be for 1.13+?

Let me check if I got an objective name right_ but otherwise here's my response:NLNLI could directly convert these commands into their 1.13+ form.NL```/scoreboard players add @p[scores={vex=1..}] money 2NL/scoreboard players remove @p[scores={vex=1..}] vex 1```NL```/give @p[distance=..3_scores={money=10000..}] minecraft:ghast_spawn_egg{EntityTag:{id:"minecraft:villager"}}NL/scoreboard players remove @p[distance=..3_scores={money=10000..}] money 10000```NL```/scoreboard objectives add creeper killed:creeper creeper```
Depending on the circumstance_ you can prevent mobs from attacking players so they can't inflict damage. Zombies with weakness shouldn't be able to knock the player back.
You're welcome!
Yessir!

The old system was inefficient_ outdated_ and crude with lots of useless commands. This updated system has a new parser_ completely rewritten commands and storage_ and merged useless commands into others so they became useful.
I have_ yeah. Scores use ranges instead of "at least <number>" or "at most <number>"

If I wanted to store the number of items I have in my hand to a score_ I'd runNL`/execute as @p store result score @s itemCount run data get entity @s SelectedItem`NLWe can do so much more thanks to the changes in the commands from 1.13
I assume you mean running a command constantly?
Redstone and commands don't mix well these days_ but some people use them still. Repeating command blocks run their commands twenty times per second_ if you need commands to be running that often.
You can use a repeating command block for the first_ and point that into an always active chain command block. They will execute together.

You can do that_ *thankfully* MCBE at least has dummy objectives. You can increase an entity's score (not sure if fake players exist) and execute if it hits a certain value. If a score increments 20 times per second_ you'd want to multiply the time in seconds you want to wait by twenty.NL`60 seconds * 20 ticks-per-second = 1200 ticks`
Ah_ that's a JSON component. For simplicity's sake_ you can shorten that to `"creeper`" with quotes around it.
And no_ command blocks can be in essentially any rotation as long as they point into each other
Yep. if you did it the other way around_ it might not work.
Yes.
It can_ yes.
They're rotational_ similar to pistons.
Huh?
It's not working now? What were you using before?
`Dollar`'s not a valid objective. If you're looking for an objective that doesn't change until you tell it to_ you would use `dummy`.NL```/scoreboard objectives add money dummy "Dollar"``
Yeah. That part hasn't changed
Is `zombie` a valid objective? If so_ make sure your score's increasing. Otherwise I'm not sure why it's not working.
Good to hear!
I'd say the actual name of the file_ but the moderation bot tends to delete it.
It's in the server(dot)properties file.
Until I memorized JSON_ I used this site: <https://minecraftjson.com/>
Unfortunately not_ it seems.
You click the Add Text button_ then insert some text at the top_ then click Add Text again.
Although... it seems this isn't updated either.

lol this was the `/give` command it gave me:NL```/give @p sign 1 0 {BlockEntityTag:{Text1:"[\"\"_{\"text\":\"asd\"}]"_id:"Sign"}}```NLWhen it should look like this:NL```/give @p sign{BlockEntityTag:{Text1:"[\"\"_{\"text\":\"asd\"}]"_id:"Sign"}} 1```
It's especially wrong in 1.14_ as oak/spruce/etc. types of signs exist. So it's a little outdated
You use backticks. It's good for ignoring discord's formatting.NL\`small block\`: `example`NL\`\`\`code block\`\`\`:NL```example```
It also supports syntax highlighting.NL```jsonNL{NL    "example": 1NL}```
A sign that... does those things? hmm
The issue with having commands like that on a sign is players will need operator permissions to run certain commands like `/give` or `/gamemode
You could_ sure [Lit]

If you want players to be able to interact with things on signs with click events like that_ you could set up a trigger objective with the `/trigger` command instead. That's what that command was made for

Trigger objectives are scoreboards that anyone can modify for themselves. They need to be activated first to change them_ and deactivate when modified.NLYou could have a sign with a click event to run a `/trigger` command that changes a trigger scoreboard_ and check if a player's score changes.NLNLLet's pretend we have a trigger objective called "test". In the sign you got your click event that has this: `/trigger test`NLThe command succeeds_ then you check for the score change in another command block: `execute as @a if score @s test matches 1.. run <command>`NLIt's rather hard to explain_ but that's the basic idea
They must have had some kind of permission to use them. Or there was some mod magic happening
Non-operator players shouldn't have access to `/give`

Most of that is the same_ just changing this:NL```jsonNL/give @p oak_sign{BlockEntityTag:{Text1:"{\"text\":\"Villager Egg\"_\"color\":\"blue\"}"_Text2:"{\"text\":\"Villager Egg\"_\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\"_\"value\":\"/give @p[distance=..3_scores={money=5..}] minecraft:ghast_spawn_egg{EntityTag:{id:\\\"minecraft:villager\\\"}}\"}}"_Text3:"{\"text\":\"$ 5_- \"_\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\"_\"value\":\"/scoreboard players remove @p[distance=..3_scores={money=5..}] money 5\"}}"}_display:{Name:"Custom Sign"}}```
Oh_ I'm in 1.14 so `oak_sign` might not exist yet.

```jsonNL/give @p oak_sign{BlockEntityTag:{Text1:""_Text2:"{\"text\":\"Villager Egg\"_\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\"_\"value\":\"/give @p[distance=..3_scores={money=5..}] minecraft:ghast_spawn_egg{EntityTag:{id:\\\"minecraft:villager\\\"}}\"}}"_Text3:"{\"text\":\"$ 5_- \"_\"color\":\"green\"_\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\"_\"value\":\"/scoreboard players remove @p[distance=..3_scores={money=5..}] money 5\"}}"}_display:{Name:"\"Custom Sign\""}}```NLLike that?
Two different colors... it's a little tricky.NL```jsonNL"[\"\"_{\"text\":\"Red\"_\"color\":\"red\"}_\" \"_{\"text\":\"Blue\"_\"color\":\"blue\"}]"```
Worked for me. What command did you use?

`Text3:""[\"\"_{\"text\":\"Red\"_\"color\":\"red\"}_\" \"_{\"text\":\"Blue\"_\"color\":\"blue\"}]"_`NLThe error lies in the JSON text being outside the original quotes_ and an extra quote on the outside
`Text3:""[\"`*`<--[HERE]`*NLThe issue still persists
The JSON is outside the quotation string
Should look like this:NL```jsonNLText3:"[\"\"_{\"text\":\"Red\"_\"color\":\"red\"}_\" \"_{\"text\":\"Blue\"_\"color\":\"blue\"}]"```
That should work. Encountering issues?
What does the error say in the command block?

``blue\"}]"_\"clickEvent\"``NLThe issue is the clickevent is outside the component.NL```jsonNLText3:"[\"\"_{\"text\":\"Red\"_\"color\":\"red\"}_\" \"_{\"text\":\"Blue\"_\"color\":\"blue\"_\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\"_\"value\":\"/scoreboard players remove @p[distance=..3_scores={money=5..}] money 5\"}}]"```NLtry that
!rank
Almost. There should be a right square bracket `}` after that last part_ at:NL...`money 5\"}}]"_display`...NLbetween the quotation mark and the comma. `money 5\"}}]"}_display`
As the `display` tag isn't apart of the `BlockEntityTag` tag
If they have operator permissions_ anyone can use it yeah
Basically. You'd need to use a `/trigger` click event
Non-op'd players don't have access to `/scoreboard` or `/give`

<@517443822578302977> Steps:NL1. Boot up the latest snapshotNL2. Navigate to your minecraft directory. `%appdata% > .minecraft > versions > 19w12b > 19w12b.jar`NL3. Open that with an explorer program like WinRAR or 7Zip_ and navigate further to `assets > minecraft > textures`NL4. Copy that folder.NLNow you'll need to make a resource pack_ and put those textures into it. There's plenty of tutorials online for making resource packs.
